title: Why doesn't Baron eat the rift monster as it's spawning?

replies.body:
Additional animation work?

We could see it in the future, but it doesn't seem incredibly high priority (they'd need to devote time and resources) when there are more pressing concerns (like all these old champs who need VGUs).

Pretty much. It was something we talked about when we were building the first version of Rift Herald. Conclusion was that we'd be better off putting the animator time into other work, champion updates included, though. 

We figured we'd reassess if Rift Herald was a clear success and something we definitely wanted to keep in the game long term. So far that hasn't been the case however. If we do find a version of Rift Herald that really nails it we'd want to revisit Baron/RH ceremony opportunities, see how getting that work done stacked up versus other stuff going on at the time. Unless that happens though it's likely to be pretty low value (in terms of upgrade to game quality) relative to other things that could be done instead.

Whats amazing is that given how many posts there are laying down real criticism and problems, such as turret first blood correlating with a 73% win rate, that Rioters spend time commenting on shit like this has no bearing on the game at all.

Turret first blood has only increased predicted win % off first tower very slightly (about 1.5%) relative to before its introduction. I read through that thread on the front page today about it. I didn't feel I could add much more to it though, since one of the first responses explained it really well already, and did so with data that seemed quite accurate (credit to LeagueofGraphs on that one). It's also something we've talked about a couple of times since adding the first turret gold and the numbers just haven't changed over time so I can't offer anything new and insightful. 

First turret's certainly a strong predictor of who will win, even with no gold at all on it that'd be fairly true though. The first team to take a turret's playing better, are more coordinated and have just given themselves more map control. It's certainly possible we could keep the benefits we see from turret first blood (additional victory condition in lane, indirect interaction with other lanes, cost to lane swapping, concentrated gold to increase odds of personal carry potential etc) with a slightly lower value. We'll likely try tweaking it slightly at some point. The mechanic itself we're still feeling really good about though.

In terms of responding to this thread? It's a question that's cropped up a number of times that I'm not sure we've ever explained our thinking on (it's a cool idea, so why haven't we done it?). It's also a really quick and easy post to make. Sorry if it's not something you're interested in, suggest not reading it if so.

I just feel like first turret shouldn't make bot lane a target. 4 man bot twice in 5 minutes = first tower ez. I think that bot lane should be less protected then the other turrets, yes, but I still think it should be more robust than it currently is.

On a side note, any update on whether practice mode is going to ship with 7.2, or do you guys still have a lot of bugs to work out?
Won't be 7.2, hoping for 7.3.
damn, are you gonna look to add more functionality in the next pbe cycle or squash the metaphorical bugs?
Bug fixing and polish mainly from memory. I know the team's got a list of additional cheat commands they're looking to add at some point, not sure on timing of those though.

Something that bothered me since the announcement of the practice mode is: could it be used for scripting?
I'm not too experienced on these things, but couldn't cheater and scripter use the coding of the practice mode to cheat in ranked games? Like there were scripts for adding more mastery points into the same bonus or selling runes for ingame gold a few years back?

The actual practice mode cheats shouldn't be an issue. All the logic for those is server side and only enabled in practice mode games.

It's possible practice mode will make it easier for scripters to find bugs to exploit. It should also make it much easier for people to reproduce and report bugs though, so overall on the gameplay side we're expecting it to be a net positive in terms of overall bug issues, whether exploitable ones or not.
meddler,what about the rageblade rework you said would be done in preseason 7,is it still planned to be done in the near future?
With this could we get the option to attach files to the report a bug section on the boards?
I dont think thats possible. Even if it were, it would be fixed asap. Besides, HotS and DotA have had practice modes for a while and no problems there!

While I dont play HotS, I used to be a very active DotA player. You almost never saw any form of scripts or hacks in DotA (at least in my experience), however from different accounts of previous League scripts it's almost certain that the 2 games can not be compared in this area. In DotA, the last major exploit (that I remember) was  where you could change the models of trees into pumpkins to see juke paths much easier. (This was actually a lot more important then youd think from reading it.) There were no actual changes to any gameplay, however. There were only model changes. I don't believe that there is any way to change any sort of in game things besides models in a live game played on DotA. League, however, has had several exploits in the past involving players changing game files. This could be in part due to the fact that DotA may have a tighter system around this or handles the game files differently- I'm not educated enough to tell you this. Assuming Riot integrates it in the right way, there shouldn't be any issues with people using any feature from practice mode into normal games or to enhance their scripts. Just my 2 cents however.

Communities are smaller, message boards are terrible, and lets face it - unless youre active in the community you wont hear about it. If youre active on League but not on HoTS, you probably wont run into many complaints about scripts on HoTS. As a side note, there have been a lot of aimbot/ult-cooldown problems reported in Overwach, but thats neither here nor there (its just something I'm aware of from the Overwatch boards). 

But if scripts exist in the game now, chances are adding a practice mode wont make it HARDER to create undetectable scripts. At best it doesnt change. At worst, scripters have another tool to refine their cheats.

Not sure how it works...

But I'd say server will only accept commands and manipulate with variables to gamefile that is labeled as Practice Mode. And this is oversimplification of the system. It's possible they have the system much more complex.
Were you guys planning on making it so you could add more bots (or even invite at least 1 friend) to practice mode?

To be honest that is kind of dangerous for them. The thing is that when interacting with the community in an official sense Rioters have to watch what they say very carefully and using someone else's words is a good way to say something you didn't mean. Meddler could have done that here and did not, because if he is going to make a statement that is going to be held as Riot's official stance on a matter he needs to put a lot of time into making sure that statement is clear, concise, and coherent with Riot's actual stance.

To be honest in a case like this Riot's official stance shouldn't even matter because as Meddler said the other thread had the data to back it up, the argument that "First Blood Gold has made this game significantly more snowball prone" is dismissed by the fact that the actual impact to winrate was barely noticeable. Yeah that and Riot isn't even sure if they want to keep the Rift Herald around/change it. It takes too many resources to kill, so you pretty much have to be stomping lane and stomping jungle and have all the lanes pushed early to even consider taking it or it being worth taking. It's really just for snowballing right now. Then if you are snowballing why take it when you're probably strong enough to not even need it. It was a good idea in theory but they made it too hard to take. I think if they just made it hit less hard, and had lower health more teams would contest it/take it. As it stands right now it's not worth the time the jungler and top laner would have to sacrifice to take it. This leaves the other lanes wide open for a gank from the enemy jungler. Or perhaps a small global buff instead of a HUGE solo buff would change it's priority.
